alert.note: Alert for Ozark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 4:39AM CDT until July 30 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN OZARK COUNTY... At 439 AM CDT, River gauge reports indicated that flooding was occurring from thunderstorms producing heavy rain. Between 3 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. The River Gauge on the Little North Fork River near Thornfield show that rapid rises are occurring and the river was above flood stage. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gainesville, Noble, Willhoit, Thornfield, Long Run and Bull Shoals Lake. This includes the following low water crossings... Turkey Creek at County Road 830, Pond Fork at County Road 883, Little North Fork River at County Road 916 and Little North Fork at Haskins Ford Road. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
